no_study.title: No ongoing study

during.title: No ongoing study
during.subtitle: Did you eat at least 8 grams of lactose during your breakfast?

neg_compliance.title: Oh no!
neg_compliance.text: You can still finish your study - just be careful to follow the schedule for the remaining days. If you miss an additional day, you will have to restart the study.

pos_compliance.title: Great job!
pos_compliance.text: Remember, do not consume any food or beverage (other than water) for the next 3 hours. You will reminded to log your symptom severity level after 3 hours.

post.title: No ongoing study
post.subtitle: At its worse, how much has your symptom impacted your day since you last ate?

likertlabels.label: Slightly
likertlabels.detail: only noticed my symptom when I focused on it

likertlabels.label: Mildly
likertlabels.detail: I could ignore my symptom most of the time

likertlabels.label: Moderately
likertlabels.detail: could continue what I was doing

likertlabels.label: Severely
likertlabels.detail: had difficulty concentrating on some tasks

likertlabels.label: Very severely
likertlabels.detail: had difficulty concentrating on any task

faqs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faqs.subtitle: If you did not find what you are looking for please reach out to us.

list.faq: What are various symptoms for IBS?
How to choose a trigger to test?
What is the symptom severity scale?
How do we define Abdominal Pain?
How do we define Bowel Urgency?
Need help deciding what to eat?
What is the meaning of life?

pvalue.title: What is a p-value?
pvalue.para1: The p-value of your study represents the probability of the result being true.
pvalue.para10: A p-value of 0.06 means there is possible evidence that the trigger you are testing in the trial can be causing your symptoms.

abdominalpain.title: How do we define Abdominal Pain?
abdominalpain.para1: The amount of pain or discomfort (uncomfortable sensation) you feel anywhere between your chest and groin.
abdominalpain.para3: A 0 would be no pain or discomfort
abdominalpain.para4: A 5 would be pain so severe it prevents you from doing your daily tasks.

bloating.title: How do we define Bloating / Gas?
bloating.para1: How full and tight your belly feels and/or how much gas (burping/farting) you are experiencing.
bloating.para3: A 0 would be no pain or discomfort
bloating.para4: A 5 would be pain so severe it prevents you from doing your daily tasks.

urgency.title: How do we define Bowel Urgency?
urgency.para1: How sudden or pressing it feels like you need to have a bowel movement.
urgency.para3: A 0 would be no pain or discomfort
urgency.para4: A 5 would be pain so severe it prevents you from doing your daily tasks.

diarrhea.title: How do we define Diarrhea?
diarrhea.para1: How frequent and/or loose your stools are.
diarrhea.para3: A 0 would be no pain or discomfort
diarrhea.para4: A 5 would be pain so severe it prevents you from doing your daily tasks.

constipation.title: How do we define Constipation?
constipation.para1: How backed up you feel and/or how hard the passage of stool is.
constipation.para3: A 0 would be no pain or discomfort
constipation.para4: A 5 would be pain so severe it prevents you from doing your daily tasks.

triggerchoice.title: How to choose a trigger to test?
triggerchoice.para1: It's best to choose something that you eat or do often, but aren't sure whether it affects you.
triggerchoice.para2: Avoid testing triggers that you are confident will make your symptoms worse. You may choose only one factor to test at a time.

setup.title: Setup a new study
setup.content: This app will guide you through self-studies to see whether eating certain food affects your symptoms. During this study, you will be asked to eat certain foo on some days and not eat that food on other days. We will aslo help you track your symptoms by sending you daily remiinders to log them.

setup2.title: 1. Choose the symptoms you are experiencing

setup3.title: 2. Choose a Possible Cause
setup3.subtitle: Which possible trigger do you want to test?

setup3_1.title: 2.1 Testing effect of Large Meals
setup3_1.para1: On randomly pre-assinged days you will be asked to eat at least 8 grams of lactose during your first meal, ideally breakfast. It is ok to eat more than 8 grams on these days.
setup3_1.para2: On other pre-assigned days you will be asked not to eat lactose during your first meal. You can eat lactose after logging your symptoms 4 hours after the meal.
setup3_1.para3: Some examples of 8 grams of lactose are:
setup3_1.list1: A cup of cottage cheese (225 grams)
setup3_1.list2: A glass of cow's milk (8 oz)

setup3_2.title: 2.2 Testing Lactose / Dairy Consumption
setup3_2.para1: On randomly pre-assinged days you will be asked to eat at least 8 grams of lactose during your first meal, ideally breakfast. It is ok to eat more than 8 grams on these days.
setup3_2.para2: On other pre-assigned days you will be asked not to eat lactose during your first meal. You can eat lactose after logging your symptoms 4 hours after the meal.
setup3_2.para3: Some examples of 8 grams of lactose are:
setup3_2.list1: A cup of cottage cheese (225 grams)
setup3_2.list2: A glass of cow's milk (8 oz)

setup3_3.title: 2.3 Testing impact of drinking Caffeine
setup3_3.para1: On randomly pre-assinged days you will be asked to eat at least 8 grams of lactose during your first meal, ideally breakfast. It is ok to eat more than 8 grams on these days.
setup3_3.para2: On other pre-assigned days you will be asked not to eat lactose during your first meal. You can eat lactose after logging your symptoms 4 hours after the meal.
setup3_3.para3: Some examples of 8 grams of lactose are:
setup3_3.list1: A cup of cottage cheese (225 grams)
setup3_3.list2: A glass of cow's milk (8 oz)

setup3_4.title: 2.4 Testing impact of eating Gluten
setup3_4.para1: On randomly pre-assinged days you will be asked to eat at least 8 grams of lactose during your first meal, ideally breakfast. It is ok to eat more than 8 grams on these days.
setup3_4.para2: On other pre-assigned days you will be asked not to eat lactose during your first meal. You can eat lactose after logging your symptoms 4 hours after the meal.
setup3_4.para3: Some examples of 8 grams of lactose are:
setup3_4.list1: A cup of cottage cheese (225 grams)
setup3_4.list2: A glass of cow's milk (8 oz)
